name: Engaging State and Local Emergency Management Agencies to Improve Ability to Prepare for and Respond to All - Hazards Events
objective: The purpose of this program is to prepare the nation’s public health systems to minimize the consequences associated with all-hazards events. The Office of Public Health Preparedness and Response/Division of State and Local Readiness (Office of Readiness & Response/DSLR) works to promote the integration of public health emergency preparedness into overarching emergency preparedness for all-hazards responses. Office of Readiness & Response/DSLR works through and with national partners to develop and enhance public health emergency preparedness.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: Section 301(a) and 317(a) of the Public Health Service Act, 42 U.S.C. section 247b (a), as amended. Additionally, this program is authorized under section 311(c)(1) of the Public Health Service Act (42 USC § 243(c)(1)).

rules_regulations: 45 CFR Part 75 for institutions of higher education, hospitals, other nonprofit organizations and commercial organizations. Additionally, please check www.Grants.gov for any relevant NOFO information regarding respective compliance requirements.
